title: Type of tea most consumed in Great Britain 2014
summary: This bar chart has 13 columns on the x axis representing Type of tea, and Share of respondents in each Type of tea on the y axis.
The Share of respondents is highest at Type of tea English breakfast and lowest at Type of tea Chai.
There is a difference of 45.0 between the maximum Type of tea English breakfast and minimum Type of tea Chai.
min_summary: This is a bar chart. It shows Share of respondents for 13 number of Type of teas.
The Share of respondents is highest at Type of tea English breakfast and lowest at Type of tea Chai.
mid_summary: This bar chart has 13 columns on the x axis representing Type of tea, and Share of respondents in each Type of tea on the y axis.
The Share of respondents is highest at Type of tea English breakfast and lowest at Type of tea Chai.
There is a difference of 45.0 between the maximum Type of tea English breakfast and minimum Type of tea Chai.
max_summary: This bar chart has 13 columns on the x axis representing Type of tea, and Share of respondents in each Type of tea on the y axis.
The maximum Share of respondents 52.0 is found at Type of tea English breakfast and the minimum is found at Chai where Type of tea is 7.0.
Second maximum Share of respondents is found at Type of tea Green.
The Share of respondents of Type of tea Chai is 7.43% smaller than the maximum value at English breakfast.
Type of tea English breakfast is higher than any other Type of teas with value 52.0, followed by Green, and Earl Grey. Down to Type of tea Chai with the lowest value 7.0.
Type of tea Peppermint, and Other share the same value 16.0.
The Type of tea Chai has 2.99 times less Share of respondents than average.
Summing up the values of all Type of teas, we get total 226.0.

data.Type of tea: Not applicable - I never drink tea
